sections.heading: Overview
content:
Linda Fine Zeman has been communicating to and about women for more than 20
years. She has been editor for a series of health and beauty magazines, author
of several books for major publishers, as well as produced marketing materials
for companies such as Clairol and Helene Curtis. Zeman's two experiences with
breast cancer (1989/1991) propelled her in a new direction, and she returned to
school to earn a master's degree in psychology and counseling. Today she has a
psychotherapy practice, teaches psychology at her local community college, and
continues to write and produce materials that are helpful to women.

Her latest work is Whose Breasts Are
These, Anyway? , an interactive workbook designed to assist women in making
sense of this breast cancer and integrating it into their overall lives rather
than making it the focal point. She lives in Virginia with her husband and
son.

sense of this breast cancer and integrating it into their overall lives rather
than making it the focal point. She lives in Virginia with her husband and
son.
